content: Purchased the Pro version for auto sync at set time, I chose 2AM every night. Does not work - although manual sync works fine. Tried to register on the forum to get help but registration has incomprehensible question about "what is your last Android version" ??? so could not register therefore could not post a question. As I say manual sync works OK but means you have to remember to do it. I gave AndSMBpro autostart permission and exemption from battery management but autosync no go. Also does not seem to support sync of more than one local directory - I wanted to sync DCIM images also another local directory containing call recordings but will not do both. The basic manual sync though works well with Windows 10 SMB v2
Great
, andsmb does almost everything I wanted to do however sometimes with large file transfers it will just stop so I give it three out of five
replyContent: Try to setup "Full wake lock" in AndSMB settins (gear icon) to make sure your device will not go to sleep mode while transferring files.

content: The reason I uninstalled is I want to be able to copy files from my phone to a choice of folders on my computer this only gives the raw upload to / which is infuriating as I then have to sort files into folders on the computer
Thanks for this app

Has a number of issues to solve to be a good SMB client. Crashes frequently on browsing paths with large number of files or folders. Lacks copy and paste between directories on the SMB server. File Expert is now my go to SMB client because it works.
it is a good product overall. but you cannot write to a normally formated SD card. which makes it somewhat useful..
Purchase the pro version for the sync feature, the app crashes before the first sync could complete.
Why does the app need permission to access the call info? Sophisticated warns it a low reputation app based on unneeded permissions.
I can't connect. When i access my samba files from Files it's working, but on the cell phone it doens't. I am connected with the phone to the same router and the same SSID.
Fast and very versitile. Great for accessing your server files remotely when used in combination with a VPN connection. Thoroughly recommended!!
ES File Explorer = 450KB/s, AndSMB = 1800KB/s enough said....
I love this utility.  Enabled easy access to SMB shares from my Android phone.  Well worth supporting by paying the pro fee just to show support and respect for this great product.
Get javascript error if I try to download file to ext SD Card
Sync dues not work and there should be an auto-detect future to find open smb shares
Took me a minute or two to get working. Trick was making sure I had the name of the remote share folder right. Using the browse button helped. :)

I Liked the base app and paid to upgrade to pro.  Got rid of ads, but the main thing I wanted was auto sync of some TrueCrypt files.  The file sizes never change but the content and dates do.  When I look into the problem, I see someone already reported this issue OVER TWO YEARS AGO... ("Sync works great as long as your files don't stay the same size." as reported by Joshua Sirrine January 17, 2013).
The app is unreliable. It hangs repeatedly. The UI is ugly and clumsy. The developer has never responded to my email.

Excellent for securely accessing Windows shares from your phone.  However, needs the option to display date stamps of files in listings to dd/mm/yyyy if in a non US country.....  Send email regarding this....  no reply.

Use this to backup/sync two Galaxies to USB drive on router. Always has issues browsing and copying files. It will continually freeze or stop in mid-transfer. PC works just fine with network share. Have to hand-hold sync.
nice App. But does not do two way sync SO not interesting for me.
Sync needs thing like sync on screen on or off.

Sync works great as long as your files don't stay the same size.  Many saved game files are always the same number of bytes but the file contents change.  AndSMB's Sync feature only compares the file size so it will miss all backups after the first one.  This may not matter for you, but is a show stopper for me.
Get an access denied when trying to run the app all of a sudden. Not impressed !

The base app has great functionality so I went for the PRO version to support the development. I have since had cause to speak to the developer, I had my questions answered in minutes and this update includes some of the extra functionality I asked about.
pro version cannot install in my samsung s3 devices. i'm already pay it from google play. and now i still using the free one.

This app does a better job of finding my Linux-based Samba share than Windows. Syncing over WiFi works better than using a USB cable. It handles my 100+ PDFs that I sync just fine. I would like better warnings if the share appears empty before it nukes my device copy however.
I like the software and its simple and easy to use. Just wish when I click sync that it would not prompt me to "Proceed". Maybe a tick to disable this?

Sync works great!  I press sync and all of my phone's pictures and videos get uploaded to my desktop automatically.  I love it!  Well worth the small cost if for no other reason than to support the developers.  Droid Bionic.
Im using this to backup pics to My NAS. Works flawless.
Had some issues connecting at one point but I think it was due to my computer.
I was trying to use the sync feature. After paying for PRO, I'm still trying... The base app is awesome, so the money is still deserved...

Sync folder function is of limited use as option to prevent device from sleeping doesnt appear to do anything. As soon as the backlight goes off downloading slows to a crawl and you have to manually keep waking it up or you'll die of old age before the sync completes.
don't buy, pro functions aren't worth it
